subject: math
title: 1st Grade Math
description: Basic math concepts including counting, addition, subtraction, number recognition, and simple story problems

questions.question: What is 2 + 3?
questions.explanation: 2 plus 3 equals 5. Count: 2, then add 3 more: 3, 4, 5!

questions.question: Count the apples: üçéüçéüçéüçé
questions.explanation: Count each apple: 1, 2, 3, 4. There are 4 apples.

questions.question: What is 5 - 2?
questions.explanation: Start with 5, take away 2: 5 - 1 = 4, 4 - 1 = 3

questions.question: Which number comes after 7?
questions.explanation: Count: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8. Eight comes after seven.

questions.question: What is 1 + 1?
questions.explanation: 1 plus 1 equals 2. If you have 1 toy and get 1 more, you have 2 toys!

questions.question: Count the stars: ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
questions.explanation: Count each star: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7. There are 7 stars.

questions.question: What is 4 + 1?
questions.explanation: 4 plus 1 equals 5. Count: 4, then add 1 more to get 5.

questions.question: What is 6 - 1?
questions.explanation: Start with 6, take away 1: 6 - 1 = 5

questions.question: Which number is bigger: 3 or 7?
questions.explanation: 7 is bigger than 3. Count to see: 1, 2, 3... 4, 5, 6, 7. 7 comes after 3.

questions.question: What is 3 + 2?
questions.explanation: 3 plus 2 equals 5. Count: 3, then add 2 more: 4, 5!

questions.question: Count the hearts: ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
questions.explanation: Count each heart: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6. There are 6 hearts.

questions.question: What number comes before 5?
questions.explanation: Count backwards: 5, 4. Four comes before five.

questions.question: What is 10 - 5?
questions.explanation: 10 take away 5 equals 5. Use your fingers: hold up 10, put down 5, you have 5 left.

questions.question: What is 0 + 4?
questions.explanation: 0 plus 4 equals 4. When you add nothing (0) to 4, you still have 4.

questions.question: Which shape has 3 sides?
questions.explanation: A triangle has 3 sides. Count the sides of a triangle: 1, 2, 3!

questions.question: Story: Maria has 3 balloons. Her friend gives her 2 more balloons. How many balloons does Maria have now?
questions.explanation: Maria starts with 3 balloons, then gets 2 more. 3 + 2 = 5 balloons.

questions.question: What is 7 + 1?
questions.explanation: 7 plus 1 equals 8. Count: 7, then add 1 more to get 8.

questions.question: Story: There are 8 birds in a tree. 3 birds fly away. How many birds are left in the tree?
questions.explanation: Start with 8 birds, then 3 fly away. 8 - 3 = 5 birds left.

questions.question: Count by 2s: 2, 4, 6, ___
questions.explanation: When counting by 2s: 2, 4, 6, 8. The pattern adds 2 each time.

questions.question: Which number is the smallest?
questions.explanation: 3 is the smallest number. Count: 1, 2, 3... 3 comes first!

questions.question: Story: Jake has 5 stickers. He gives 1 sticker to his sister. How many stickers does Jake have left?
questions.explanation: Jake starts with 5 stickers and gives away 1. 5 - 1 = 4 stickers left.

questions.question: What is 8 + 2?
questions.explanation: 8 plus 2 equals 10. Count: 8, then add 2 more: 9, 10!

questions.question: How many sides does a square have?
questions.explanation: A square has 4 sides. All 4 sides are the same length!

questions.question: Story: Mom baked 6 cookies. Dad ate 2 cookies. How many cookies are left?
questions.explanation: Mom baked 6 cookies, Dad ate 2. 6 - 2 = 4 cookies left.

questions.question: What is 9 - 4?
questions.explanation: 9 take away 4 equals 5. Use your fingers to count down from 9.

questions.question: Which number comes between 4 and 6?
questions.explanation: 5 comes between 4 and 6. Count: 4, 5, 6.

questions.question: Story: Anna has 2 red crayons and 3 blue crayons. How many crayons does she have in total?
questions.explanation: Anna has 2 red crayons and 3 blue crayons. 2 + 3 = 5 crayons total.

questions.question: What is 6 + 3?
questions.explanation: 6 plus 3 equals 9. Count: 6, then add 3 more: 7, 8, 9!

questions.question: Count the dots: ‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢
questions.explanation: Count each dot: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8. There are 8 dots.

questions.question: Story: There are 7 ducks in the pond. 4 more ducks join them. How many ducks are in the pond now?
questions.explanation: Start with 7 ducks, then 4 more join. 7 + 4 = 11 ducks total.

questions.question: What is 10 - 3?
questions.explanation: 10 take away 3 equals 7. Count backwards from 10: 9, 8, 7.

questions.question: How many corners does a triangle have?
questions.explanation: A triangle has 3 corners (vertices). Each corner is where two sides meet.

questions.question: Story: Ben collected 4 shells at the beach. Then he found 3 more shells. How many shells did Ben collect?
questions.explanation: Ben found 4 shells, then 3 more shells. 4 + 3 = 7 shells total.

questions.question: What is 5 + 5?
questions.explanation: 5 plus 5 equals 10. This is a double! 5 + 5 = 10.

questions.question: Which number is greater: 6 or 4?
questions.explanation: 6 is greater than 4. When counting: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6. 6 comes after 4.

questions.question: Story: There are 9 flowers in the garden. A rabbit eats 2 flowers. How many flowers are left?
questions.explanation: Start with 9 flowers, rabbit eats 2. 9 - 2 = 7 flowers left.

questions.question: What is 7 - 3?
questions.explanation: 7 take away 3 equals 4. Count backwards: 7, 6, 5, 4.

questions.question: Count by 5s: 5, 10, ___
questions.explanation: When counting by 5s: 5, 10, 15. The pattern adds 5 each time.

questions.question: Story: Lisa has 8 toy cars. She gives 3 cars to her brother. How many cars does Lisa have now?
questions.explanation: Lisa starts with 8 cars and gives away 3. 8 - 3 = 5 cars left.

questions.question: What is 1 + 8?
questions.explanation: 1 plus 8 equals 9. When you add 1 to any number, you get the next number.

questions.question: How many sides does a circle have?
questions.explanation: A circle has 0 sides. It's perfectly round with no straight edges.

questions.question: Story: There are 5 apples on a tree. 2 apples fall down. How many apples are still on the tree?
questions.explanation: Start with 5 apples, 2 fall down. 5 - 2 = 3 apples still on the tree.

questions.question: What is 9 + 1?
questions.explanation: 9 plus 1 equals 10. This gives us our first two-digit number!

questions.question: Which number comes right before 10?
questions.explanation: 9 comes right before 10. Count: 8, 9, 10.

questions.question: Story: Tom has 6 marbles. His friend gives him 4 more marbles. How many marbles does Tom have altogether?
questions.explanation: Tom has 6 marbles, then gets 4 more. 6 + 4 = 10 marbles altogether.

questions.question: What is 8 - 5?
questions.explanation: 8 take away 5 equals 3. Use your fingers: 8 - 1 - 1 - 1 - 1 - 1 = 3.

questions.question: How many wheels does a bicycle have?
questions.explanation: A bicycle has 2 wheels - one in the front and one in the back.

questions.question: Story: Sarah saw 3 butterflies in the morning and 4 butterflies in the afternoon. How many butterflies did she see in total?
questions.explanation: Sarah saw 3 butterflies + 4 butterflies = 7 butterflies total.

questions.question: What is 4 + 4?
questions.explanation: 4 plus 4 equals 8. This is another double! 4 + 4 = 8.

questions.question: Story: There were 10 candies in a jar. Children ate 6 candies. How many candies are left in the jar?
questions.explanation: Start with 10 candies, 6 were eaten. 10 - 6 = 4 candies left in the jar.
